body.p: You have received a dataset with 10,000 observations, and 30 variables. One of your important variables has missing values for 3,000 observations. How can you handle the missing values:

multiple_choice.choice: You should use the list wise deletion technique and ignore all observations that have missing values in this variable.
You should first investigate why the values are missing before determining the next steps.
You should replace the missing values with a mean value since you do not want to lose 30% of your observations.

feedback.p: Incorrect: This is a premature move that could result in a loss of data and an incorrect analysis.
Correct: A significant number of your observations have missing values. You should investigate the reason behind the missing values.
Incorrect: There is no indication of the data type, imputation using mean values might not be the answer.

body.p: You use this process to extract portions of the dataset prior to the start of your analytic solution development. This method involves excluding variables instead of observations:

feedback.p: Correct: It can be used to handle missing values and low quality data. It is not a sampling technique.
Incorrect: Sampling is used when you can not gather data from the entire population. It is used to give representative analysis for a population.
Correct: This is different from what is described above. Imputation replaces missing values and does not exclude them.

body.p: How do you handle creating dummy variables for a categorical variable with more than two levels:

multiple_choice.choice: You create k-1 dummy variables and use the last category as a reference category.
You gather the variables that have the largest occurrence and ignore those with smaller occurrences as they hold no meaning.
You create an "other" category for the categories that are smaller in number.

feedback.p: Correct: This is the general rule used in this situation.
Incorrect: Even the smallest occurrence can hold meaning to a model and analysis.
Incorrect: This will result in a loss of data.
